ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: General physics and calculus knowledge
This class gives a pretty solid foundation in mechanics - forces, dynamics, motion linearly and rotationally
Kinematics, Newton's Laws, energy, rotational motion, waves and oscillations
Basic knowledge of beginner physics
I learned more about kinematics, mechanics, rotation, waves, and more.

- fundamental concepts relating to physics (including kinematics, dynamics, circular and rotational motion, waves, and simple harmonic motion)
- how to solve problems using these fundamental concepts
This course was a great introduction to the basics of physics. Many topics such as energy, dynamics, mechanics, and more were covered in the class.
I gained a better overall knowledge of how to look at complex problems and break them down using formulas. Provided me not only with physics knowledge but problem solving knowledge.

Introductory concepts foundational to physics including (but not limited to): kinematics, dynamics, 1- & 2- dimensional motion, rotational motion, circular motion, energy, gravitational concepts, simple harmonic oscillators, and momentum.
This was my first Physics course so I learned everything from physics to forces to rotation to waves.
Mechanical physics: kinematics, forces, energy, rotational motion, gravity, oscillations and waves.

Learned the basics of mechanical and dynamic physics- motion/velocity/acceleration in translation and rotation, forces, gravitation, wave motion, oscillations, springs, energy, momentum, etc.  Good overview of the most essential topics in physics.
Introduction to physical concepts!
I learned about the laws of physics and how the application of physics into our daily lives.
I learned a basic introduction to physics and mechanics, and a basic understanding of various physical principles.

This course provided a thorough overview of Mechanics and related topics, condensed into 5 weeks. The short timeframe of the class makes practice essential. Through the homework and weekly quizzes, I was able to strengthen my concepts and find areas of weakness. It was also an opportunity to improve on my knowledge from high school Physics and gain more insight into topics I had learnt briefly before.
Mechanics - Kinematics, Dynamics, Friction, Rotational Motion, Waves.

I learned a lot about basic physics concepts in a way that I think is applicable to both daily life and also to theory. This will be a helpful foundation for the MCAT. I think we focused more on conceptual learning which meant that this was not too math intensive at all which I personally really appreciated.
learned a lot about mechanics and vectors
How to apply basic formulas describing laws of classical mechanics, kinematics, rotational motion, work, energy, etc.
Basic physics: kinematics, dynamics, rotation, waves
Foundation in physics, particularly in mechanics
Introductory physics concepts (similar to AP Physics 1)
I learned the fundamentals of mechanics topics using calculus-based physics.
I gained a good understanding of calculus based physics - mechanics.
Kinematics, conservation of energy/momentum, work, angular, etc. Basically the same course as AP physics C Mechanics.
basic understanding of introductory physics
Fundamentals of physics

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the lectures could have been more structured, sometimes it was hard to follow and the professor sped through concepts pretty quickly. If I didn't have high school physics background coming into this course, it would have been extremely difficult.

Strengths - Mehdi knows the material very well and teaches clearly. The only weakness was the confusion that comes with such a fast paced course. There wasnt much downtime for transitions, so lecture was 100% content
I know it's a compact course, but the professor needs to slow down when teaching. I would rather have had longer class time than have him speak so quickly

The weakness of this course is that each lecture crams in entire units, and it is hard to keep up if you haven't read or prepared yourself beforehand. However, the strength is the care of the professor and TAs for the students. They want to see you succeed and will help you whenever you ask.

- strengths: super friendly prof who is very good at explaining concepts, very fair assessments, clear organization and expectations
- weaknesses: I've had other classes with better TAs (maybe it could have helped if they had been in our classes/had a better understanding of exactly how and in what way the prof was teaching us)

Strength of this course- it isn't quite in depth, so you only need a foundational understanding of the material and then you can apply that knowledge to multiple cases. A weakness would be how fast paced the course is, it is very easy to fall behind.
The course was very well organized and straight forward. The course could be improved by being more clear about which things in lecture will or will not be covered on the exam.

Strengths: Mehdi is a great professor and he does a good job of providing us with the most important information.
Weaknesses: This class is very hard to take online and requires a great deal of concentration and involvement to suceed.
Course material was on the occasion incorrect and would pass by uncorrected. Overall, good pacing of the course material aside from the few mistakes that slipped by.

Being a summer course we moved forward really quickly, but that can't be helped. One piece of input would be for the homeworks, especially the ungraded final one, it would be nice if all of the problems were odds, so we could check our answers in the book to make sure we were doing them correctly.

Strengths: Professor explained things well, workload not overwhelming, so many options for TA and professor office hours. 
Weaknesses: I wish we spent more time on the last few topics, since I felt they were very rushed.  I think sections would be more useful if they were more structured, since sometimes I felt like we didn't get much done.
Sections go a little slow and the material is sometimes hard to follow since the class goes so fast. but the practice problems were very helpful in class.

The course does a great job encompassing a lot of general physics topics in such a short amount of time. The structure of the lecture is set up nicely but I think the sections should be more structured to be more helpful. Whether it's the TA giving a 15-minute review, taking questions and then working questions, or simply working questions the entire time I think the questions should be picked out ahead of time so it's more beneficial. Another idea is that the sections could go through a worksheet that is the same for each TA to eliminate the strengths and weaknesses of the TA. Moreover, I think it would be extremely helpful if the TAs could attend lecture because it was difficult to ask a question about the lecture when the TAs weren't there because they often didn't know what we had talked about or learned in a day.

Strengths - exams were quite fair, PSETs were good to prepare for the exams, material was taught quite clearly

Weaknesses - sometimes the quizzes didn't correspond with the material we learned in class, sometimes there were gaps in conceptual knowledge

Strengths: Interesting enough content and the professor's lectures are generally structured well. 

Weaknesses: TA session felt pointless, only going over homework problems and a five minute quiz. Office hours (via zoom) felt kind of disorganized. The "oral exam" aspect of the course didn't make any sense.

The professor is really accommodating and truly wants to reward improvement. He is always willing to meet and help assess how a student can improve, since the course is very fast-paced, which can not be avoided. I think the syllabus was very clear, and I always knew what was expected of me. The workload was not heavy in terms of PSETs a such, but since we do almost a chapter a day, it will be heavy on the studying end of things to keep up with the material.

Professor Mehdi is a strength of the course because he is really nice and genuinely wants his students to do well (and isn't as strict on the percentage breakdown of final grades) but his teaching style might be harder for people who don't have as much physics experience, background knowledge...etc

This is a summer class, and it has to move fast. But the instructor spent every class deriving as many formulas as possible with very little by way of intuitive explanation, making it hard to feel like I was actually learning anything at a deeper level. However, if you just want to get a science requirement out of the way, this is perfect - the summer session went by super fast.
Strengths: Good lecture format, weakness: moves really fast so a lot of concepts are not explained well.
Lots of great practice problems and practice exams, felt like it was easy to fall behind from lectures, but to be somewhat expected considering the fast paced nature of a summer course

Strenghts: straight-forward lectures, strong teaching team, great TA's that are always willing to help, workload and problems assigned were manageable and relevant in terms of difficulty to the exam
Weaknesses: the pace (but it is a summer class), besides that this is a great summer class option

Overall this course was good. Mehdi is a good lecturer (he does go a little fast but that's the nature of summer courses), and although there is a limit to how great an online class can be he did well under the circumstances. I was also really pleased by the amount of help available to us outside of class - usually at least one TA was holding office hours every day. I do wish the sections were structured more - I liked having the quizzes that we did together but the Q&A with the TA, which took up most of the section time, seemed unnecessary since there were already so many office hours being held. If I were to make alterations to the course, I would add more quiz questions in sections, and let us work together on them for more of the section time because I think those kinds of activities facilitate learning and reinforcing information really well. Lastly, I never really understood why we had an oral section for the final exam - it seems to me that the written final is enough to measure our competency in the course.
strength is the lectures are to the point and exams are fair. weakness is that the discussion sections are not that helpful
the discussion sections were not very helpful, the professor was terrific.

The class did a good job at following the textbook, however often the class moved far too fast (perhaps this is just a side affect of being a summer class). I think a slower pace would definitely help the course
Went too fast

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you have an interest in physics and if its required. However I don't recommend taking. it online
Sure, if you're premed or need this as a requirement
If you really like physics, this is a great class!
Yes, a good foundational physics course.
Yes, but this course is fast-paced so make sure you don't overload yourself and are prepared to stay on top of each unit and not cram everything in.
You probably have to take it for pre med or your major...it's a lot of work in the summer, but I think it's worth it...you definitely learn a lot, with a great professor! I'd recommend it
Yes, even though this course was very challenging I enjoyed learning with my teaching fellows and my professor.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone who enjoys math, problem solving, and some challenge. I had a great time in this class and feel like I have learned so much about physics in such a short period of time.
Take it during the summer in comparison to the year; however, do not take physics unless you have a strong background in the knowledge prior.
Indifferent, since I was already familiar with the course material so my opinion is skewed.
Yes. I personally found being able to focus just on physics was nice, so I'm glad I took it over the summer.

Even if you aren't required to learn physics, I think that it is important to have a better understanding of how the world works. It is eye-opening to see the different forces and physical phenomena in action.

Yes, I was nervous going into this course but it really wasn't as difficult as I was expecting.  Professor is very adept at explaining concepts and he's funny too.  My TA was great and really helped me succeed in the course.  From what I've heard, the class is easier if you take it over the summer.
It is good if you need for a pre med requirement.
If they are interested in physics, yes I would. I would suggest taking it in a normal semester though because the fast pace makes it harder to enjoy the content.
I would not recommend this course to another student unless it was for a pre-requisite.
Take this course if you're willing to put in a significant amount of hours to doing practice problems and can attend a lecture 4 days a week and a TA session another two days.

Yes, I think that if you are ready to manage the fast pace of the course, it is a way to expedite the same learnings of a whole semester in 5 weeks and since I am not interested in physics, this was ideal for me
I would only recommend this course if it was a major or premed requirement because it is a lot of work in a very short amount of time, especially in the summer
Yes, it is nice to use summer to do physics.
Would recommend, relatively lower stress class but physics is fun to learn
Yes, great option if you want to focus just on physics or get a head start on the intro physics classes
Only if they are required to take it.
Yes but don't take it if it's not a requirement unless you really love physics because it really is just pure physics lol

If you have a strong background in physics, definitely take it over the summer. I had taken AP Physics 1&2 and Physics C in high school so doing the homework I was just reviewing what I had already learned. I cant imagine how difficult this would be to actually be learning all of this material for the first time at this pace. It is doable but will take significantly more time.
Yes- efficient way to learn introductory physics

It is a requirement for many students, so yes, however, if you have the option to take 170 and dont have much experience in physics, I would probably take that. It can be tough at times, and sometimes you can study and study and still pull terrible grades on the exam. Luckily, the grading is done in such a way that it prioritizes participation and doing the homework/ going to section!
Yes, a needed requirement
